title: Identify the data unit at each layer
text:
Each layer of the Internet protocol stack exchanges a specific unit of data:

Application Layer – exchanges messages (the data generated by the application).

Transport Layer – exchanges segments (TCP or UDP segments, encapsulating application messages).

Network Layer – exchanges datagrams (packets that include addressing information for end-to-end delivery).

Link Layer – exchanges frames (encapsulating datagrams for delivery between neighboring devices).

Physical Layer – transmits bits (the raw 0s and 1s on the medium).
